00002 //
00003 // KDataFileIO.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 5/11/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // The base class for the KDataReader and KDataWriter classes. This class
00011 // does the basic tasks of opening the TFile and setting the branch addresses
00012 // The user should not interact directly with this class, except for the public
00013 // methods that KDataReader/Writer inherit. However, using the methods in this 
00014 // class shouldn't be necessary to perform an analysis of the data stored in an
00015 // KDS file. 
00016 //
00017 
00018 #include "KDataFileIO.h"

00021 #include <string>
00022 #include "TBranchElement.h"

00028 KDataFileIO::KDataFileIO(void)
00029 {
00030   InitializeMembers();
00031 
00032         fFile = 0;
00033         fTree = 0;
00034         
00035 }

00037 KDataFileIO::~KDataFileIO(void)
00038 {
00039   Delete();
00040 }

00042 void KDataFileIO::InitializeMembers(void)
00043 {
00044   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00045   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00046         
00047         //THESE ARE DEFAULT VALUES AND SHOULD NEVER BE CHANGED!
00048         fTreeName = "t";
00049         fTreeTitle = "KDSTree";
00050         fBranchName = "event";
00051 
00052 }
00053 
00054 void KDataFileIO::Delete(void)
00055 {
00056         
00057         Close();
00058         if(fFile != 0) {
00059                 delete fFile; fFile = 0;
00060         }
00061          
00062 }
00063 
00064 void KDataFileIO::CreateTree(void)
00065 {
00066         
00067         fFile->cd();
00068         
00069         if(fTree != 0) {
00070                 delete fTree; fTree = 0;
00071         }
00072                 
00073         fTree = new TTree(fTreeName.c_str(), fTreeTitle.c_str());
00074         
00075         if(fTree->IsZombie())
00076                 cout << "KDataFileIO::CreateTree TTree is Zombie" << endl;      
00077         else {
00078                 //fTree->BranchRef(); //force the user to turn this on 
00079                 fTree->SetCacheSize(10000000);
00080                 fTree->AddBranchToCache("*");
00081         }
00082 }
00083 
00084 void KDataFileIO::GetTreePointerInFile(void)
00085 {
00086         
00087         fFile->cd();
00088         
00089         if(fTree != 0) {
00090                 delete fTree; fTree = 0;
00091         }
00092         
00093         fTree = (TTree *)fFile->Get(fTreeName.c_str());
00094 
00095         if(fTree == 0){
00096                 cout << "KDataFileIO - Couldn't Find Tree " << fTreeName.c_str() << " in file " << endl;
00097                 return;
00098         }
00099         if(fTree->IsZombie())
00100                 cout << "TTree is Zombie" << endl; 
00101 }
00102 
00103 
00104 Bool_t KDataFileIO::Close(Option_t *opt)
00105 {
00106         //every time we close the file, we delete the Event pointer. 
00107         
00108         if(fFile == 0){
00109                 fTree = 0; //the tree should be have been deleted. 
00110                 return true;
00111         }
00112         
00113         fFile->Close(opt);
00114         
00115         if (fFile->IsOpen()) {
00116                 return false;
00117                 //return false if we couldn't close the file.
00118         }
00119         else {
00120                 delete fFile; fFile = 0;
00121                 fTree = 0; //the tree is deleted by the TFile
00122                 return true;
00123         }
00124         
00125 }
00126 
00127 
00128 TFile* KDataFileIO::OpenFileForWriting(const Char_t* name, const Char_t* option, 
00129                                                                                                         const Char_t* title)
00130 {
00131          
00132         fFile = new TFile(name, option, title); 
00133         //MUST do this after initializing the TFile
00134         CreateTree();
00135         
00136         return fFile;
00137 }
00138 
00139 TFile* KDataFileIO::OpenFileForReading(const Char_t* name)
00140 {
00141         
00142         fFile = new TFile(name, "read");
00143         
00144         GetTreePointerInFile();
00145 
00146         return fFile;
00147 }
00148 
00149 Int_t KDataFileIO::GetEntries(void) const 
00150 {
00151         if(fTree!=0) return fTree->GetEntries();
00152         else return -1;
00153 }
00154 
00155 const char* KDataFileIO::GetFileName(void) const
00156 {
00157         if (fFile != 0) {
00158                 return fFile->GetName();
00159         }
00160         else return "";
00161                 
00162 }
00163 
00164 const char* KDataFileIO::GetEventClassName(void) const
00165 {
00166         if(fTree != 0){
00167                 TBranchElement *branch = (TBranchElement *)fTree->GetBranch(fBranchName.c_str());
00168                 if(branch != 0)
00169                         return branch->GetClassName();
00170                 
00171                 else return "";
00172         }
00173         else return "";
00174 }
